name: Eva Beleznay
membership: Vice-president of Hungary Green Building Council (HuGBC) http://www.hugbc.hu/english?lang=en
goal:
I am a senior consultant in integrated sustainable urban development, climate adaptation and sustainable energy and climate action plans (SECAP), with a special focus on participation and cooperation based project development.
I have experience in urban planning, design and research, both in the public and private sector. My work included being the chief architect/planner of Budapest, where I promoted holistic, feasible and human-centered city planning.
My life and work have always been defined by environmental and social responsibility, way before sustainability became part of the professional dialogue in Hungary.
I believe that a good researcher/consultant is able to transform the grand visions of urban development to specific steps and solutions, and the other way around: everyday practice gives a valuable perspective for policy recommendations.
Currently, I am the vice-president of the Hungary Green Building Council. I also am a BREEAM assessor.
interests: Climate Action, Digital economy and society, Energy, Environment
